strats.note: In reality, bombs lead to 1 and not 3, but 1->3 and 3->1 are free so it doesn't matter.

strats.name: Moat Reverse Jump
note: Execution of this strat is non-trivial, and failing will lead to falling into the pit.
Depending on item loadout, that could be a softlock.

to.note: Because Moving from 1 to 3 is free, all strats are represented here even if they start at 1.

bypassStrats.name: Bowling Skip
note: 1- Grapple on a ripper to get position inside the wall under the door.
2- Do a Crystal Flash to force a standup.
3- X-Ray climb up to the door trigger.

strats.name: Base
strats.note: The shot blocks can be destroyed without using bombs

strats.name: West Ocean Bug Boost
note: Get a Zeb to move left into the morph passage, and reach the end of the tunnel before it.
Must be quick enough to shoot the shot block first, but certainly doable with a mockball.
One might break the shot block beforehand with Wave, but getting into the tunnel quick enough without mockball still doesn't seem realistic.
This strat is a one-shot try and failure is a softlock.

strats.name: Base
strats.note: The shot blocks can be hit from afar without bombs, and there is enough time to get past them without Gravity before they respawn

strats.name: Base
strats.note: It's horribly time-consuming, but this can be attained without any items or techs.

strats.name: Base
strats.note: Super is for a Super Block. It's not an obstacle because it respawns.

strats.name: Base
strats.note: Super is for a Super Block. It's not an obstacle because it respawns.

strats.name: Beat West Ocean Super Block Respawn
note: It's possible to go 12 -> 14 -> 10 -> 14 -> 12 before the Super block respawns, if going quick enough.
Note that this representation of the strat would need to be reworked if there were another way to access 14 or 10.
